body_html:
object seems special. But a subclass of it seems to be working:

>>> from test_torch import TestTorch
>>> TestTorch.__bases__
(<class 'common.TestCase'>,)
>>> import unittest
>>> issubclass(TestTorch, unittest.TestCase)
True
>>> class Dummy(object):
...   pass
...
>>> TestTorch.__bases__ = (Dummy,)
>>> issubclass(TestTorch, unittest.TestCase)
False

body:
`object` seems special. But a subclass of it seems to be working:
```py
>>> from test_torch import TestTorch
>>> TestTorch.__bases__
(<class 'common.TestCase'>,)
>>> import unittest
>>> issubclass(TestTorch, unittest.TestCase)
True
>>> class Dummy(object):
...   pass
...
>>> TestTorch.__bases__ = (Dummy,)
>>> issubclass(TestTorch, unittest.TestCase)
False
```
